channel.title: 194 progress [updated 8-3-09]
channel.description:
I just wanted to post some of my progress with my 194 project.
For those of you who don't know, which is probably almost all of you, I've been refactoring a 194 client for the last few weeks. I've been dumping all the data I could get my hands on, since it's so easy. It's somewhat fun to look through the old RS2 data, so, erm, enjoy ;)
[url=http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/items.html]RS2 194 Items list[/url] [url=http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/npcs.html]RS2 194 NPCs list[/url] [url=http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/objects.html]RS2 194 Objects list[/url] [url=http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/textures/index.html]RS2 194 Textures dump[/url] [url=http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/dump/backgrounds/index.html]RS2 194 media indexed image dump[/url] [url=http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/dump/sprites/index.html]RS2 194 media game image dump[/url] [url=http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/dump/wordenc/index.html]RS2 194 word encoding dump[/url] [url=http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/interfaces.html]RS2 194 Interface dump[/url] [url=http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/interface-resources.html]RS2 194 Interface resource dump[/url] [url=http://jaghax.ws/rsclient/docs/index.html]RS2 194 Re-named client documentation[/url]
Some explanations to each. The items list previews are based on the inventory images. I can't explain why some don't appear, beyond some name problems. As for the NPCs, some of the previews are outside the image area. They are also somewhat difficult to see (just like the objects). This is because they were rendered on a 500x500 canvas, then resized to a 100x100 image. They have empty scanlines that I didn't bother to remove, otherwise they would be a bigger size. On the objects list, some don't appear because of the arguments I used to render them. I may be able to dump a more completed preview list later on.
Indexed images are images that use a palette for color referencing. In Mopar's 317 re-named client, these are known as 'backgrounds'. Game images are regular 24-bit RGB images, and are known as 'sprites' in Mopar's re-named client.
Two of the four word encodings are a little unknown to me. Though I'm positive badenc.txt is the actual censor list, and domainenc.txt contains all banned urls.
Note for the documentation: I created it right after I packaged up the source. Some of the 'undetermined' classes have been determined and placed in their proper places.
Edit: I added the interface dump and interface resource dump. The rendered interfaces you see are only the interfaces with valid children ids. I'm not entirely sure why some of them don't render anything, but it doesn't matter too much. Interfaces, like objects, are too diverse to be dumped with 1 common method.
I also updated the items, npcs, and objects lists to include examine info.
If you have any questions, or want the source, just post here. I also have a fixed copy of graham's Shard Revolutions that peter included with his post.

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:19, topic:290190”]hi, i started re-refactoring mopar’s 317 client according to your naming scheme and discoveries

http://s11.info/c/rs317.tar.gz

i havent worked on it for a few days and wont be for a few more days because im not at home

this is in no way complete, but yeah, enjoy.[/quote]rep++ babe 0mg. Been wanting one of these for a while

item.title: 194 progress [updated 8-3-09]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:17, topic:290190”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=383596.msg2897057#msg2897057 date=1249272214]

[quote author=blakeman8192 link=topic=383596.msg2894223#msg2894223 date=1249101292]

Is anyone going to release a server for this? And, if so, do you want it as an option in moparscape?
[/quote]I’ve been working on a server framework (will be open-source) and talking about it with Taharok and other programmers. We’ll see how far it comes.

Yeah, how’s that going? My lack of a power adapter kinda hits our project a little hard, wouldn’t you agree?
[/quote]Pretty good, the engine is complete and it’s very lightweight but still pretty robust. I have yet to completely comment it but I’ll get to it soon. When do you think you’ll be able to get a new power adapter? Everyone misses you :P[/quote]

It just came today. Long story, but to sum it up, I had to buy 2 power adapters just so I could get one by today or tomorrow. It’s just good to be on my laptop again, etc.

Edit: I updated the items, npcs, and objects lists to include examine information. I also added partially-complete interface and interface resource dumps.

Read full topic

I think blakeman8192 and graham were going to work on one this weekend. I agree though, it would be pretty cool to have in MoparScape. There is one small problem: there are no 194 landscape files lying around,

item.title: 194 progress [updated 8-3-09]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Is anyone going to release a server for this? And, if so, do you want it as an option in moparscape?

I think blakeman8192 and graham were going to work on one this weekend. I agree though, it would be pretty cool to have in MoparScape. There is one small problem: there are no 194 landscape files lying around, so we have to use converted 317 landscape data. It’s really a big mess right now.

Lothy:

It’d be pretty cool, wouldn’t it? This is the first version of RS2 right?

Yep, first public beta release.

Read full topic

item.title: 194 progress [updated 8-3-09]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I just wanted to post some of my progress with my 194 project.

For those of you who don’t know, which is probably almost all of you, I’ve been refactoring a 194 client for the last few weeks. I’ve been dumping all the data I could get my hands on, since it’s so easy. It’s somewhat fun to look through the old RS2 data, so, erm, enjoy

RS2 194 Items list
RS2 194 NPCs list
RS2 194 Objects list
RS2 194 Textures dump
RS2 194 media indexed image dump
RS2 194 media game image dump
RS2 194 word encoding dump
RS2 194 Interface dump
RS2 194 Interface resource dump
RS2 194 Re-named client documentation

Some explanations to each. The items list previews are based on the inventory images. I can’t explain why some don’t appear, beyond some name problems. As for the NPCs, some of the previews are outside the image area. They are also somewhat difficult to see (just like the objects). This is because they were rendered on a 500x500 canvas, then resized to a 100x100 image. They have empty scanlines that I didn’t bother to remove, otherwise they would be a bigger size. On the objects list, some don’t appear because of the arguments I used to render them. I may be able to dump a more completed preview list later on.

Indexed images are images that use a palette for color referencing. In Mopar’s 317 re-named client, these are known as ‘backgrounds’. Game images are regular 24-bit RGB images, and are known as ‘sprites’ in Mopar’s re-named client.

Two of the four word encodings are a little unknown to me. Though I’m positive badenc.txt is the actual censor list, and domainenc.txt contains all banned urls.

Note for the documentation: I created it right after I packaged up the source. Some of the ‘undetermined’ classes have been determined and placed in their proper places.

Edit: I added the interface dump and interface resource dump. The rendered interfaces you see are only the interfaces with valid children ids. I’m not entirely sure why some of them don’t render anything, but it doesn’t matter too much. Interfaces, like objects, are too diverse to be dumped with 1 common method.

I also updated the items, npcs, and objects lists to include examine info.

If you have any questions, or want the source, just post here. I also have a fixed copy of graham’s Shard Revolutions that peter included with his post.
